alert.note: Alert for Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 10:50AM EDT until July 14 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Sampson and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1050 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. In particular, Clinton and Turkey are likely to see heavy rain in the next 2 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Goldsboro, Clinton, Mount Olive, Fort Liberty, Fremont, Walnut Creek, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Eastover, Roseboro, Stedman, Pikeville, Newton Grove, Wade, Salemburg, Turkey and Falcon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
